intro: Bigelovia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf bigelovia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight aromatic scent. Bigelovia stricta is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
